Graduate Home / Explore Graduate Programs / Classroom Climate Certificate (Online)

Classroom Climate Certificate (Online)

Degree

Classroom Climate Certificate

Schools

EducationGraduate, Global, and Online Education

Department

Regional Training Center (RTC)

At a Glance

This 15-credit, five-course certificate equips teachers with advanced instructional methodology and reflective practice skills. Courses — including Increasing Student Responsibility and Self-Discipline in Learning Communities and Styles of Teaching — cover areas ranging from motivational techniques to bullying to conflict resolution, emphasizing teaching methods that help every student succeed.

Program Coordinator: Melissa Meagher, meagherm@tcnj.edu

Duration

  • part time: 1–2 years

Availabiliy

  • off campus and online*

5

  • courses

15

  • credits

$685

  • per credit

Who Should Pursue This Program?

If you’re a licensed K–12 educational practitioner — a teacher, administrator, or school leader — who wants to better understand and react to what you experience in the classroom, this program is a perfect next step. Ideal candidates are certified teachers who want to either pursue an initial master’s degree or move to master’s +15 or 30 levels on the salary guide.

Careers

Most of our graduates are already working as K–12 teachers. This certificate contributes to their advancement on the salary guide and prepares them for additional educational positions and responsibilities in teaching, but not for transitioning to administration.
